metadata.title: CVE-2021-21165 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Data race in audio in Google Chrome prior to 89.0.4389.72 allowed a remoteattacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
